title: Integrate the factory-ts package
description:
A local package was created that is currently placed in `packages/factory-ts` relative to this project.
This package allows calling agents to run on specific projects, tasks and features. It needs to be integrated into this project so agents can be ran on specific tasks or features and agent performance can be monitored. If at any point changes are required in the factory-ts - those can be applied directly.

features.title: Add the local 'factory-ts' package into this project
features.description:
The package is located at `packages/factory-ts`
The factor-ts documentation is
`packages/factory-ts/FACTORY_TS_OVERVIEW.md` whereas the configuration documantion is: `packages/factory-ts/CONFIGURATION.md`

features.title: factory-ts needs to mirror original python scripts
features.description:
factory-ts has been adapted from working python scripts that run agents. factory-ts should do EXACTLY the same as is the orchestrator flow inside run_local_agent.py.
That class references a few markdown files that are always supplied to the agents - those are all under packages\factory-ts\docs . There's no need to inspect them - just use them in exactly the same way as they are used in run_local_agent.py.
For this feature to be complete the orchestrator should mirror exactly the run_local_agent.py orchestrator. task_utils.py is only supplied as reference, as in this project (Overseer) we already have most of these tools in place. This feature is only about the orchestrator, places where equivalent task_utils.py and git_manager.py functions would be used can be stubbed out for now.

features.title: TaskDetailsView improvements after running an agent
features.description:
The AgentRunBullet should use the same chip styles as a DependencyBullet.
Both features and tasks can only ever have 1 agent running on them.

features.title: Running an agent doesn't work
features.description:
There are no messages exchanged when an agent is run (on a task or a feature). It seems the whole orchestrator loop isn't sending messages to an LLM. Write more logs so it's possible to determine where things go wrong (ideally you can find it and fix).
only console logs like the one below get emitted:
[factory] event run_mf2wd43g_e1om5p run/progress/snapshot usage/update

features.title: factory-ts is the source of truth when it comes to Project,Task,Feature types
